idea-plugin.name: LocalizedJPA
idea-plugin.description:
LocalizedJPA Support for IntelliJ IDEA

The official IDE plugin for LocalizedJPA library that provides seamless IntelliJ IDEA integration. Makes synthetic methods generated by the annotation processor at compile-time visible in the IDE.

‚ú® Features

  • Full Autocomplete Support - Code completion for both default methods (getName(), setName(String)) and locale-aware methods (getName(Locale), setName(String, Locale))
  • No Red Underlines - Methods generated by annotation processor are recognized by IDE
  • Automatic Configuration - One-click annotation processing setup
  • Smart Detection - Automatically detects LocalizedJPA library when project is opened
  • Translations Field - Support for translations field and its getter/setter

üöÄ How It Works

LocalizedJPA library adds multilingual getter/setter methods at compile-time to entities annotated with @LocalizedEntity and @Localized. This plugin makes these methods visible in the IDE, improving the development experience.

üìã Usage Example

@LocalizedEntity
@Entity
public class Product {
    @Localized
    private String name;
    
    // IDE now recognizes ALL methods:
    // - getName() / setName(String)
    // - getName(Locale) / setName(String, Locale)
}

üì¶ Requirements

  • IntelliJ IDEA 2025.2+
  • Java 17+
  • LocalizedJPA library

This plugin is the official IntelliJ IDEA support for the LocalizedJPA project.

üìñ Quick Start

  1. Install this plugin from the marketplace
  2. Add LocalizedJPA library to your Maven/Gradle project
  3. When prompted, click to enable annotation processing
  4. Start using @LocalizedEntity and @Localized annotations
  5. Enjoy full autocomplete support for synthetic methods!
